CN.AbilityDialogWarningItem: If you use this item or feature, it will end concentration on {item}
CN.AbilityDialogWarningSpell: If you cast this spell, it will end concentration on {item}
CN.AbilityDialogWarningSpellLevel: If you cast this spell at a level other than {level}, it will end concentration on {item}
CN.AbilityDialogWarningUnfocusedItem: You may use this item or feature, but you cannot maintain concentration on it.
CN.AbilityDialogWarningUnfocusedSpell: You may cast this spell, but you cannot maintain concentration on it.
CN.FlagConcentrationAbilityHint: The ability this character uses for saving throws to maintain concentration.
CN.FlagConcentrationAdvantageHint: This character rolls with advantage to maintain concentration.
CN.FlagConcentrationBonusHint: A bonus to saving throws to maintain concentration. This field supports dynamic values such as @classes.sorcerer.levels as well as dice expressions.
CN.FlagConcentrationReliableHint: This character cannot roll below 10 to maintain concentration.
CN.FlagConcentrationUnfocusedHint: This character cannot concentrate on any spells or items.
CN.ItemNotFound: The item being concentrated on does not exist on the actor.
CN.NotifyConcentrationChallenge: {actorName} has taken {damage} damage and must make a DC {dc} {saveType} saving throw to maintain concentration on {itemName}.
CN.NotifyConcentrationChallengeManual: {actorName} must make a DC {dc} {saveType} saving throw to maintain concentration on {itemName}.
CN.SettingAbilityUseWarningHint: If enabled, show a warning if the usage of an item or spell would end concentration on a different item.
CN.SettingDefaultConcentrationAbilityHin: The ability that is used for concentration checks by default, for all actors in the world.
CN.SettingDefaultIconHint: An image path here will replace the default icon used for the concentration effect.
CN.SettingPrependLabelHint: If checked, concentration effects are prepended with 'Concentration' to distinguish them from other effects.
CN.SettingShowGainLoseConcentrationMessa: If enabled, messages will be shown about actors beginning or ending concentration.
CN.SettingShowUtilButtons: Show Utility Buttons on Gain/Lose prompts
CN.SettingShowUtilButtonsHint: If enabled, show the 'End Concentration' and 'Remove Templates' buttons on the messages that appear when an actor starts or ends concentration.
CN.SettingSplitItemNamesHint: When creating a concentration effect, remove any part of an item's name preceding a ':'.
CN.SettingUseItemIconHint: If checked, the image used for concentration effects will be overridden by the item's image.
CN.SettingVisualActiveEffectsButtonsHint: If enabled, and using 'Visual Active Effects', concentration effects will be supplied with quick access buttons for rolling different properties of the item.
CN.SettingWhisperMessagesHint: If enabled, all messages about beginning or ending concentration will be whispered to owners and all GMs instead of respecting roll modes. This does not affect the save prompts, which are always whispered no matter what.
